prompt: <description>Part 1: Construct a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The first part is a rectangular prism with a slightly tapered top and bottom. The top and bottom faces are parallel to each other, while the front and back faces are perpendicular to the top and bottom faces. The sides of the prism are straight and meet at right angles. The dimensions of the prism are approximately 2:3:4. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: -90.0, 0.0, -90.0 * Translation Vector: 0.1606, 0.0, 0.0 Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system with the following properties: * Sketch Scale: 0.75 The sketch contains a single face (face\\_1) with one loop (loop\\_1) made up of four lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, and line\\_4): * line\\_1: Start Point [0.0, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Start Point [0.75, 0.0], End Point [0.75, 0.5625] * line\\_3: Start Point [0.75, 0.5625], End Point [0.0, 0.5625] * line\\_4: Start Point [0.0, 0.5625], End Point [0.0, 0.0] Now, transform the 2D sketch into 3D by applying the coordinate system's Euler Angles and Translation Vector to the sketch. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following properties: * Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.0038 * Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.0 * Sketch Scale: 0.75 This completes the first part. Part 2: Construct a series of cylindrical shapes arranged in a staggered pattern. The second part is a series of cylindrical shapes arranged in a staggered pattern, with each subsequent cylinder decreasing in size. Begin by creating a new coordinate system with the following properties: * Euler Angles: 0.0, 0.0, 0.0 * Translation Vector: 0.0, 0.0933, 0.2813 Next, create a 2D sketch on the XY plane of the new coordinate system with the following properties: * Sketch Scale: 0.647 The sketch contains four faces (face\\_1, face\\_2, face\\_3, and face\\_4), each with one loop (loop\\_1) consisting of a single circle (circle\\_1): * face\\_1: + loop\\_1: circle\\_1 with Center [0.0738, 0.0738] and Radius 0.0738 * face\\_2: + loop\\_1: circle\\_1 with Center [0.0738, 0.2403] and Radius 0.0738 * face\\_3: + loop\\_1: circle\\_1 with Center [0.0738, 0.4067] and Radius 0.0738 * face\\_4: + loop\\_1: circle\\_1 with Center [0.0738, 0.5731] and Radius 0.0738 Now, transform the 2D sketch into 3D by applying the coordinate system's Euler Angles and Translation Vector to the sketch. Extrude the sketch along the Z-axis with the following properties: * Extrude Depth Towards Normal: 0.1406 * Extrude Depth Opposite Normal: 0.1406 * Sketch Scale: 0.647 This completes the second part.</description>

For the sketch of part 1, create a new face (face\\_1) and on this face, draw a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of 4 lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) as follows: * line\\_1: Starting from [0.0, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.0] * line\\_2: Starting from [0.75, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.3333] * line\\_3: Starting from [0.75, 0.3333] and ending at [0.0, 0.3333] * line\\_4: Starting from [0.0, 0.3333] and ending at [0.0, 0.0] Once the loop is complete, proceed to scale the sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale which is 0.75. After scaling, transform the 2D sketch into a 3D sketch by defining the euler angles as [0.0, 0.0, 0.0] and the translation vector as [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. Lastly, to create the 3D model, extrude the sketch along the normal direction with an extrusion depth of 0.5417 units. **Part 2: Creating the Second Rectangular Prism** Begin by creating a new coordinate system for part 2 with the euler angles set to [0.0, 0.0, -90.0] and the translation vector set to [0.0, 0.0, 0.0]. For the sketch of part 2, create a new face (face\\_1) and on this face, draw a loop (loop\\_1) consisting of 4 lines (line\\_1, line\\_2, line\\_3, line\\_4) as follows: * line\\_1: Starting from [0.0, 0.5417] and ending at [0.25, 0.0] * line\\_2: Starting from [0.25, 0.0] and ending at [0.5, 0.0] * line\\_3: Starting from [0.5, 0.0] and ending at [0.75, 0.5417] * line\\_4: Starting from [0.75, 0.5417] and ending at [0.0, 0.5417] Once the loop is complete, proceed to scale the sketch using the scaling parameter sketch\\_scale which is 0.75. Instead of creating a new model, we will cut into the first rectangular prism. Therefore, we set the extrusion depth towards the normal direction as 0 units and the extrusion depth opposite to the normal direction as 0.1667 units. Thus, a smaller rectangular prism will be formed by cutting into the first prism, aligning with the provided description of the "final shape".</description>
